11.title: The Berry Shop

111.content:
Initial by Twines


         What had happened was Charizard had seen Umbreon being harassed at a Pokémon Café. He had taken Umbreon’s side in hopes that a petty confrontation could settle without much disturbance. Once, just once he intervened, and there lay a long-lasting friendship for years. Umbreon had settled close to Charizard, deeming him as his best friend, and, frankly, only one. The only one around, anyway. The rest of his friends seemed to have faded out of his memory. Umbreon’s old friends, not from grief, or anger, but simply a memory of when he was an Eevee. Charizard and Umbreon had been sharing a room for some time now, at least a year.
         Charizard however didn’t find himself in the same boat. Umbreon was his only friend, his first and ever. His compulsive unnerving from not being around Umbreon edged him want to be there whenever Umbreon needed something. Charizard would be right behind him, and above, a towering dragon with his large frame and threatening posture. When he entered the room, it was made apparent that Charizard would seriously maim you if you as much as pinched Umbreon. Whether or not he was the reason for Umbreon not making too many friends was never up for debate. His little friend always looked to be talking with someone, given that someone would likely be glancing at Charizard every once in a while, because sure enough Charizard would be doing the same.
         Despite Umbreon’s best efforts, he could not seem to anger Charizard unless it was entirely indirect. Part of Umbreon believed that even if he bit Charizard’s tail that the dragon, instead of turning around and flaming the dark-type, would try to ram into the Pokémon sitting across the room. The only thing about Charizard that made Umbreon feel off was if someone had been particularly rude to him, for some reason they would not be seen again. It wasn’t as if Umbreon really wanted to see them again anyway, but just that it was awkward to stumble upon Charizard shortly after, when the dragon was obviously trying to hide something. Namely a bulge.

         Umbreon was sure a looker. Charizard craved for anything from that dark-type. A nudge… a brush against his flesh… a gentle grope— or a rub… a swipe of Umbreon’s tongue… he longed to feel his little friend. At times where Umbreon and Charizard had separate places to be, Umbreon at the Berry Center or Charizard at his own job, Charizard’s brain was always on the Pokémon he had helped so long ago. Else, Charizard would be off in the distance, eyes twitching with lust, the rising pit of pleasure rising from his gut, the wondrous sensation he imagined it would be to finally get Umbreon’s red-faced, half-groggy returned stare while laying on soft sheets of their shared room. He always wondered if Umbreon felt the same way— he’d not asked— but he hoped from the slight rosiness from Umbreon’s cheeks when he was near that his presence did turn something on in the Umbreon.
         Charizard was lucky enough to get his massive body in the room Umbreon slept without making noise, save for the flickering of his tail. He loved to tease himself by placing his tapered penis close to Umbreon’s face or rear when either were visible without covers. Charizard would grow hungry though, and go out, finding something to eat… or someone if he was really turned on that night… yet, his balls did ache more often than he wanted too. Charizard could always empty them, but filling them?
         Umbreon woke up one morning with a slight twitch to his nose, Charizard’s gut dropped when he realized it was his own pre, but the moonlight Pokémon never noticed because of early-morning drowsiness, and proceeded to wash up in the shower. Days after it became an issue. Charizard unintentionally left more and more on the Umbreon every night, causing the dark-type to scratch his body more often than usual. Charizard wondered if Umbreon ever thought of it. Did Umbreon just shrug it off as it just being Charizard’s scent rubbing off on him? It’s been happening for the past two weeks, up to now.

         The duo were walking together into their home. They had gotten to split the rent by a one in a million chance, and it was the best thing to happen to both of them in the past year. The house was only a block away, and Charizard had been on edge that whole two mile trek from Umbreon’s workplace and the house, dreading over Umbreon’s possible reactions to his request— Charizard’s request to mate. He planned on asking Umbreon when they were settled inside… but his nervous sweating didn’t help at all when Umbreon was occasionally glancing up at him.

111.title: "Stalker"

1111.content:
Tsuki


         While Umbreon was known to be quite oblivious to those around him, Charizard's nervousness did not go unnoticed by him. It was quite clear he had something on his mind, but he dare not ask. He never was the one to coax others to express their bottled up emotion, even if it was his closest friend, though Umbreon had to admit, Charizard's nervousness was definitely beginning to take a toll on him. Nothing like a nervous, sweating, fire dragon eight times your size to leave one feeling uneasy regardless of how close of friends they were.
         Umbreon let loose a long yawn as he stretched, the cool feeling of the wooden flooring greeting his sore paws with a welcoming chill after the long walk, before heading off towards the bedroom the two mons shared. He leaped into the massive bed with a fwumph, purring aloud as he felt himself sink into the cool blankets—a small pleasure in life he would never get tired of.
         As Umbreon let the soft blankets embrace him, he began to ponder over the journey back home with Charizard. What could he possibly have on his mind that had him so nervous? He did not dwell on it for long though as he was reminded of something quite important he felt he needed to address.
         "Hey Charizard I forgot to mention we have a new co-worker up at the Berry Center! I hope you don't mind but I invited them to come over this evening so we could get to know each other!" He yelled so as to be sure Charizard heard, one ear cocked as he waited for a reply.

1111.title: Umbreon's Perspective

11111.content:
Twines


         Charizard's heart dropped— he had not gained the courage to ask Umbreon while walking home, and now— this?
         "That's, nice," Charizard choked. He spun around slowly in the kitchen, his eyes darting at the cabinets and drawers and such without pause. What was he going to do? His eye twitched slightly until he closed them and looked down. Charizard then shook his head in small, rapid successions to clear his thoughts.
         I've got to think of something, Charizard thought. I mean, how bad could it be? I'm just trying to get in with Umbreon... but then who's the new co-worker? It was typical of Umbreon to bring in new people to meet every so often. Charizard cocked his head in annoyance. Oh come on! Why tonight?!
         Mustering up the courage he'd not had the whole day, Charizard called back to Umbreon. "What's their name? What kind of Pokémon are they?" Charizard rubbed his head and began to breathe slowly to calm himself.



Tsuki


         Bree sat up, a new set of tasks at hand now that he remembered he would be having company over later in the day.
         "His real name is Tai, but I've been calling him Flare as he's not very fond of his birth name—" he spoke as he made his way to the large walk in shower before turning on the water, raising his voice so his roommate could hear him over the spray of running water. "He's a Flareon who started working with us about a week or two ago. His main job is to collect weeds and burn them so we can use the ashes for compost," Umbreon proceeded filling Charizard in about his new fellow employee as he groomed himself under the running water.
         "He is incredibly shy, as well as new to the area, so he does not know a whole lot of other Pokémon, so try not to scare him to bad if you answer the door," he joked as he continued to clean himself.



Twines


         “Flare?” Charizard repeated under his breath. “A fire-type… unique name… a Flareon— another Eevee Pokémon…” Charizard racked his brain thinking about what to do. This had been the night, this was his night, he wanted Umbreon for himself. He clenched his claws.
         Charizard was angry, yet his heart dropped, who was he angry at? Umbreon? How could he— how dare he— be angry at his friend? The dragon swept into the living room and slowed himself to a stop at the couch.
         It was a large enough couch for both an Umbreon and a Charizard to sit together. More like two Charizards, but that’s besides the point. Now it would be for a third Pokémon for that night. Charizard placed his claw along the line of the soft couch and traced the edge until his claw drifted into the air. He gagged internally, then inhaled one last time, very slowly.
         “I’ll try not to,” Charizard finally called back.
         “Well that was a bit long for a response, wasn’t it?” Umbreon called. The sprinkling of the shower against both the Pokémon’s fur and the shower walls reached out to Charizard. The dragon twitched again.
         “Was looking outside,” he lied. Charizard did decide to approach the window though. He craned his neck to peek outside.

         Minutes later, wouldn’t you know it— Umbreon’s new co-worker ‘Flare’ was timidly padding up the sidewalk. The faint orange fur contrast with the growing darkness outside, Flare had approached the door before Charizard had time to think of what to say.
         Luck was on his side though, and Umbreon was too far away in another room to hear everything. Charizard quickly dashed away from the window and stood behind the door. For Umbreon’s sake, he needed to be collected for this new ‘friend’.
         A knock on the door signaled for Charizard to grasp the handle and allow entrance. As the door was side open, Charizard was able to take in the appearance of the Flareon. Flare flinched at the near immediate reaction to his presence at the house, and his face almost seemed shocked to find a large, orange dragon instead of a small, black Umbreon.

         Flare opened his mouth to speak…



Tsuki


         But nothing came out, instead Flare just stood there, eyes wide, frozen in place, not sure what to say. Flare, unlike the Umbreon he had been working with for the past week or so, found it difficult to interact with others aside from the occasional greeting when he happened to run across guests that insisted they pick their own berries instead of letting staff do it. The Umbreon made it seem so easy. Maybe that's way he did not find it hard to talk to him.
         "H-h-hello!" Flare blurted out due to his nervousness, only making things even more awkward for him. Oh my god it would have helped if Bree would have mentioned he had a Charizard as a roommate of all things! He internally screamed. He knows good and well I don't do good around new mon! Maybe he gave me the wrong address!? I know he's oblivious but damn!
         "Are—are you... is this where Bree lives?" Flare stuttered. trying desperately to form words into a coherent sentence. Already he could feel the blood rushing from his body as he began to get cold feet. He could feel his world getting smaller with every passing second he stood before this giant among Pokémon as he tried to maintain eye contact, but finding himself unable to. Damn it! Why did I have to be born with such a timid nature!
         Deep down he truly wished he was just given the wrong address. He was not sure he could handle this prolonged feeling of awkwardness for very long as he stiffened up.



Twines


         “Umbreon’s here, yes,” Charizard stated. The Flareon stared at the dragon's feet, unable to look him directly in the eye. “You're Flare, right?”
         “Y— yeah.”
         “So you're the coworker he was talking about,” Charizard said with discovery, Flare became tense again.
         He was talking about me? What did he say? What does his roommate know? Flare worried, not budging from his spot in front of the door. “You live with him?” Flare managed only those words.
         “Mmm-hmm. Yep. And you?”
         “M— me what?” The Flareon kept looking down, his stomach turning with every second in front of this huge dragon. A chill went down his spine, Me what—? Me what! What'd I do? Did I do something wrong? “Oh, sorry!”
         Charizard paused. “Sorry for what?”
         “Sorry for disturbing you!” Flare spun around and shyly started for the sidewalk. I can't do this right now, I'll just… say I found the wrong address! He then pictured in his head the following conversation that next day about why he wasn't there.

         Charizard immediately gawked—he took a quick look back inside, his heart dropping past his gut by now—he'd already spooked Flare off!
         “Wait—!” Charizard called, slightly panicked. Flare jumped and his ears flattened. “You're alright, no worries! Come back, I can grab Umbreon for you,” he offered, letting the door open.
         Flare moaned quietly to himself, Awhhw! No… now what is Bree gonna think? The Pokémon turned back around to see Charizard’s tail slip back into the house. He looked back out to the street, Can I still…? He frowned, the door was still open. I've gotta close that though! Awh…
         Flare entered and eventually closed the door behind him. He took in the look of the living room, the small dip of Umbreon’s spot on the couch compared to Charizard’s much more craterous one. Meanwhile, Charizard stood before the entrance into the bedroom.
         “Flare’s here,” Charizard called “and I didn't scare him off," the dragon looked back at Flare.

111111.content:

         The two could hear Umbreon chuckling to himself from across the house as his voice echoed of the bathroom walls.
         "That's good to hear! I may have forgot to mention that my roommate was a Charizard— my bad Flare!" he shouted, a nervous laugh soon followed as well as the sound of him shaking his coat.
         I fucking knew it! Of course he would forget to mention something like that... Flare sighed. "You would forget to give me an address if I didn't ask for it..." he muttered to himself, his shyness eclipsed momentarily by slight agitation, but he still managed to keep his composure and laugh it off as to not come off sounding offensive. He would how ever have a few choice words for the Umbreon next time they meet up at work.
         "I should be done in a moment! Can't have myself leaving puddles all over the place," the Umbreon spoke aloud before the silence was broken by the loud whirl of an air drier kicking off.
         I hope you come out looking like a poof... Flare thought to him self before he nervously looked up at the Charizard, still finding it hard to bring himself to look him in the eye for longer then a couple of seconds.

         Come on Flare— just say something for god's sake! "S-so...uhh— do you go by any other n-name? Or is Ch-Charizard what you p-prefer?" God this stutter is going to be the death of me! Flare took a deep breath before speaking again. "I-I'm sorry, I'm not good in s-social situations," Flare tried to mask his feeling with a nervous smile as he waited for a response from the rather intimidating Charizard while still struggling to make proper eye contact with him.




Twines



         “Charizard is my name,” Charizard stated blankly. Flare was still for a second to process that.
         “I— I see,” the flareon whispered. Flare was not able to keep eye contact, that he could tell. Charizard stared at Flare’s back from above. “I— my name is Flare.”

         “I see,” the dragon copied. “Can you see me from looking down so much?” Flare only shook more, much to Charizard’s annoyance. “You know, maybe if you could see other Pokémon’s faces you wouldn’t have to be shaking like that in front of me.”

         Flare clenched his eyelids shut, Why’d you go and bring that up?, he complained. “Maybe,” he whispered. The Flareon knew that what Charizard said had some factor into his timidity, but it was hard, so hard! To his luck Umbreon seemed to have gotten out of the shower at this point. Charizard watched Flare as he slowly crept past him… if only he knew how awkward it was. “Bree you in here?”

His tail fluff, his adorable ears, his drooping tail… his little butt… Charizard exhaled with difficulty. He was arousing himself without meaning to. Maybe if he got Flare to leave before the night ended, he could finally have some fun time with Umbreon.
         It then struck him. He had two Eeveelutions in the bedroom ahead. One of them was a worthless fire type, while the other was his best friend. Charizard’s eye twitched and he started to become more and more turned on. The flesh hidden by a slowly widening slit wasn’t easy to hide at all when he was horny. He hatched an idea, a sick idea, but possibly one he could pull off. It required the best of circumstances. Charizard sat on the couch while the two Pokémon in the other room talked. He smirked.
         If Flare is still here by the time Umbreon is asleep… Charizard will make use of such a possible cum load. Charizard lolled his tongue out, his rod having extended to a foot.
         Though, Umbreon wouldn’t just ignore this friend going missing— Flare's nice and is another evolution in their line—what could he do to fix that? Well... maybe he didn't have to make Flare into a load of cum. That's a bit risky... Could I have some fun with both of them maybe? Charizard thought lustily.

111111.title: They Wait for Umbreon

1111111.content:
Tsuki


         "Wow," Flare muttered as he stepped into the bedroom. "That is a huge bed..." Flare had to look up to see the top. It must have been at least a foot or two above his head, and would require him to leap to make it up there. The frame of the bed itself looked like a small, but sturdy wall with a thick comforter, sheets, and a plush, black blanket that matched the wood frame, cascading over the top of it. That's not so... surprising, his roommate is a Charizard after all, he thought as he began to scan the room for the Umbreon he saw walk by earlier.
         "Um... Bree? Where did—"
         "I'm up here," Came a voice from above. A soft gentle glow emanated from the Umbreon's forehead, giving away the spot he had chosen to relax. He had been there the whole time Flare had stepped in, his head hanging over the corner of the bed, watching Flare with his matching yellow eyes. "You seem surprised?"
         Flare just stared at him. A tinge of agitation gnawing at him. He really wanted to give Bree a piece of his mind for not giving him a proper heads up, and putting him through what he would personally consider hell, but as he looked deep into those yellow eyes he felt that anger fade. How could this Umbreon he only met a little over a week ago have such a calming effect on him? How do you do it?Already he could feel his nerves loosen... finding the voice he struggled so hard to find.
         "Does— does it not bother you having a bed you have to jump onto to get in?"
         "Why don't you jump up here, and you tell me?" Bree spoke as he patted a spot down along side him.
         "Umm... okay?" Did he just invite me to join him in bed? No— he's just being...Bree. The Umbreon who he watched converse with a Loppuny on the first day of the job, completely oblivious to her flirtatious antics! I still can't believe he was so confused about why that Loppuny was so upset with him! This was just another one of those moments. Flare reared his hind legs as he prepped for the leap, then with a "Hmph!" he sprang up onto the bed.

         As soon as Flare's paws made contact with the plush surface, he felt the bedding beneath him sink significantly; far more then he expected in fact. "What the—!" Was all he could manage to say before landing with the grace of a newborn Ducklett. Everything went dark as he sank deep into the mattress. All sound muffled except for Bree's laughter which rang throughout the room after watching his new friend face plant into the bed, only his fluff visible beyond the horizon of covers that enveloped his body upon impact.
         "You gotta just plop yourself on the bed, otherwise you're gonna sink in real deep!" Bree chuckled as he watched Flare remain motionless. "Soft huh?" Bree smirked while skillfully making his way over to where Flare laid, before plopping himself down along side him, lifting him a little out of the bed.

         Flare could feel Bree's body touching ever so slightly against his fluffy mane, a blush of embarrassment burning beneath his bright red fur. He was not used to being so close to another, but he maintained his composure some how, enjoying as the bed hugged around him. This— this feels incredible!
         "What on earth is this bed made of!?"
         "Altaria down—fairly expensive stuff, but it's fire proof and ungodly soft!" Bree said with glee as shimmied in place a little, sinking him self deeper into the bed. Flare found himself being pulled closer by gravity, but he did not fight it. He felt far too comfortable to even bother. He could feel the warmth of the Umbreon as his body made contact with his.
         I don't get it— how can I be okay with this? It's almost like I've known him for years!? His thoughts were interrupted by the Umbreon's soothing voice as he spoke with out his normal excited tone.
         "Hey— you really shouldn't allow what others think get to you... you know?"
         Flare just laid there... listening what his new friend had to say.
         "You can't please everyone in this world... no matter what you do. Dwelling on how others think of you will only make things far worse," Bree's usual excitement was beginning to bleed through his speech again "throw caution to the wind and be yourself! Let your personality do the talking for you!" His voice started to die down again.
         "It will be hard at first, but over time you will find it easier to be yourself around others. Take it slow and in small strides," the Umbreon gave flare a gentle smile.
         Flare could feel his body temperature rising rapidly; A totally new feeling of embarrassment washed over him, one he'd not been expecting.
         What am I feeling? Am I seriously falling in love with Bree!? Flare began to shift a little. He could feel his groin aching; His member started peeking from his sheath and pressing tightly against the plush mattress bellow. No, no, no! This cannot be happening! I can't let him notice me like this—

         "Flare? Are you ok­?" Bree was cut off as Flare stood up suddenly, tail lowered to hide his shame.
         "I'm sorry Bree—I forgot—there's something I must go take care of!" Flare did not even give Bree a chance to respond before leaping off the bed, heading towards the living room where the exit was located.
         "Wait! Flare!?" Bree cried out, very confused by what was happening.




Twines



         Charizard had managed to calm his lusts down by walking to the kitchen, opening the fridge, and just standing there. The cool air immediately caused him to sneer and gain some composure. His plan was set: either wait for Flare to leave or Umbreon to sleep.

         “... you o.k.—?”
         “I’m sorry Bree—,” the dragon cocked his head around the fridge door “... something I must go take care of!” Charizard raised a brow, there was some shuffling in the other room.
         “Wait! Flare!?” Umbreon’s confused voice traveled to the kitchen where Charizard was. The dragon's face turned serious for a second as he walked towards the bedroom door—

         Fwump!

         “Bwah!” Flare squeaked, he had run face first into Charizard’s legs. The dragon sharply inhaled in surprise but no harm had come to him, meanwhile Flare had his paws over the top of his head, moaning. The Flareon’s momentary plight of nervousness was overcome by a bruise forming on the top of his head. “Awh!”
         Umbreon had left the bedroom to find a disgruntled Charizard looking at him for help, standing over a bamboozled Flareon.
         “Flare, are you alright!” Umbreon rushed over to Flare while Charizard sat down on the carpeted floor in front of the startled fire-type. “What happened?”
         “He er—ran into my leg I think and uh—now he’s kind of just there on the floor now,” Charizard explained rather bemusedly. Umbreon glanced up at his roommate, only to go back to tending Flare. Umbreon brushed his side against Flare’s and sat next to him while in front of Charizard’s spread legs.

         “Calm down Flare,” Umbreon cooed. Charizard was taken aback slightly by his cooing. “You're fine, you're fine,” he nudged Flare’s shoulder. Flare has done this before. Instead of dealing with his problems upfront, sometimes Umbreon would see Flare in the back room with his tail down and about had his whole head in an empty planter box. Comical as it was, Umbreon pitied him. This was generally the result of a rude customer, but what set him off this time? Normally there was something plausible, but... he was being nice to Flare.
         “Ow,” Flare complained again. Umbreon managed to make him stand, soon leading the startled Flareon to the couch.
         “Charizard, can you go get him something?” Umbreon asked. Charizard nodded, stood up, and walked to the kitchen again. With Flare situated on the couch, Umbreon felt the need to comfort him more. Why did Flare bolt? Umbreon wondered.
         The sound of the Charizard’s thumping suddenly made him think. Oh. He's worried about Charizard. So it wasn't me then, thankfully.


         Charizard didn't get anything from the kitchen yet, opting to just stand and listen. He peeked his head out from around the corner and glared at Flare. Umbreon cooed for him! For that wimpy Flareon! Charizard clenched his claws. “You never cooed for me!” Charizard whispered crossly. He watched as Umbreon comforted Flare openly, becoming jealous by the second.

1111111.title: Two Eeveelutions, One Room

11111111.content:
Tsuki



         "Jeez you hit your head pretty hard," Bree mumbled staring at the knot that had formed just above Flare's brow. "Leave it to you to hit the one part of Charizard's leg that wasn't padded!" He said with a lighthearted laugh as he continued to rub Flare's shoulder. Already he could feel Flare starting to relax a little. "Who would have thought a knock on the head was all you needed— it's a good thing they let me take some of the berries home as a part of my pay!" He joked in a attempt to lighten the mood.

Thankfully the whole ordeal preoccupied his mind long enough that he no longer felt the presence of his cock peaking out from his sheath. Thank god nobody noticed. The thought of that awkward situation made his current predicament so much easier to cope with.
         "Close... but you would need to hit your head a lot harder then that before you would need one of those— unless you're seeing stars. You aren't seeing stars are you?" The Umbreon asked quizzically as he looked into Flares eye's for a moment. "How many rings do you see on my face?"
         "N-no— I'm not seeing stars or anything like that," Flare spoke as he winced again, this time using the sore spot as a way to distract himself from the Umbreon's gaze, before having his paw lightly swatted away.
         "Stop poking it—and the berry you would want is the Oran berry— Persim is to treat confusion. You could also use Lum berry as a cure all, but unless you want the boss lady to chew you out, I don't recommend that..." Bree shivered a little as he recalled the day he got caught using Lums as a go to for everyone's problem. He didn't know they were so hard to grow, single-handedly causing a shortage of said berry for about a month on his first week of the job.

         "Hey Chariz— oh! Did not see you sneak up on me there..." Bree spoke as he reached for the ripe Oran berry he brought back before promptly thanking him then he used one of his paws to score a triangular shaped mark into the rind roughly the size of the bump on Flare's head, then peeling it away and sticking it between the Flareon's eyes like it were a post-it.
         "Uhh.. what was—" Flare was cut off as the Umbreon handed him the rest of the berry.
         "Eat this—and leave that berry rind on that bump—it will help speed up the healing process," Bree spoke before jumping off the couch.
         Flare crossed his eyes at the dark blue patch that had been placed on his head; giving it a few pokes. Flare’s main job is to collect weeds and burn them so we can use the ashes for compost.”

He probably ‘forgot’ of course! The light pouring in from the outside vanished as the door closed, replaced by Charizard’s naturally lit tail. One of Flare’s ears perked when he heard the faint drizzle of the shower, then he stopped. The floor was carpeted.

         The dragon tentatively stepped forward. “Didn’t Bree tell you I’d be here?” Flare shook his head. “Of course he didn’t,” Charizard in turn shook his head as well. Now what do I do… this Flareon’s all shook by me already. Bree was right about him being so timid, and it’s sort of depressing.
         “Where is he, the shower?”
         “Yes.”
         “Oh…” Flare’s ears dropped while his tail seemed to fall. Charizard made sure not to make too sudden of movement, as he didn't want to make Flare uncomfortable, and swept back over to the couch. The dragon was sure that maybe if he looked casual that Umbreon’s friend could relax in turn. While sitting down, Charizard looked back at Flare.
         “Wanna wait for Bree with me?” The dragon offered. Flare raised a brow, and a crooked paw, then he quickly glanced at the open door frame to where the shower noises came from. The Flareon mumbled something under his breath while exhaling exasperatedly.
         “... s—sure,” Flare slowly moved towards the massive couch.
         I swear, if I didn't know he was so fucking nervous I'd tell him to see a Poké-center for all that shaking, Charizard huffed internally, … he does look cute though. Flare hopped up onto the other side of the couch.
         Umbreon’s voice sounded from the shower “I'm almost done, I'll be out in a second!”

This is being developed into a Quest game.

More stories will come eventually.

Most of the time it's a bother to read "there are plenty of interactives for you to add to," but it's true. There are hundreds of interactives that you could add to that need it more than this one, (because this one has a plan), and there's something for about everyone on this site, whether it be rated-E fantasy and happiness or XGC Porn, there's little doubt you won't find another place.
